name: Judaism (Biblical)
notes: Linear covenant; divine law; transcendent Yahweh.

name: Christianity (Liberation)
notes: Latin American liberation theology; praxis of the poor; God in history and justice.

name: Buddhism (Zen/Chan)
notes: Direct pointing to mind; non-dual practice (Chan→Zen); meditation-centric realization.

name: Buddhism (Pure Land)
notes: Other-power faith in Amitābha; chanting/nembutsu; accessible path for laity.

name: Buddhism (Tiantai)
notes: Threefold truth synthesis; contemplation frameworks; Chinese scholastic integration.

name: Buddhism (Tendai)
notes: Japanese Tiantai; inclusive synthesis of ethics/meditation/esotericism.

name: Buddhism (Shingon)
notes: Esoteric mantra/mandala body of Buddha; ritual realization; immanent sacred.

name: Buddhism (Nichiren)
notes: Lotus Sutra exclusivism; daimoku chanting; world-transforming agency.

name: Ancient Egyptian
notes: Maʿat/cosmic order; Nile cycles; participatory rites; immanent sacred within state theology.

name: Mesopotamian (Sumerian/Akkadian)
notes: Seasonal/astral cycles with fate (šīmtu); temple economy; immanent-yet-ordained cosmos.

name: Canaanite/Phoenician
notes: Storm/sea and fertility cults (Baʿal/Asherah); ritual renewal; kinship with land/sea.

name: Hittite/Anatolian
notes: Storm-god pantheon; treaty oaths; agrarian cycles; ritual maintenance of order.

name: Hellenic Polytheism (Classical)
notes: Civic cults; oracles & Moira; immanent gods entwined with polis.

name: Orphism (Greek)
notes: Soul purification & rebirth; initiatory myth; cyclical cosmos.

name: Eleusinian Mysteries
notes: Demeter–Persephone cycle; initiatory renewal; experiential immanence.

name: Roman State Religion
notes: Pax deorum via rites/auspices; civic reciprocity with gods; pragmatic immanence.

name: Roman Mithraism
notes: Solar/astral grades; initiatory agency; moral discipline within cosmic cycle.

name: Early Vedic (Ṛgvedic)
notes: Ṛta (order) via sacrifice; cyclical fire/sky cult; immanence trending to later Vedānta.

name: Celtic (Druidic)
notes: Animist groves; seasonal feasts; land-relation and participation.

name: Norse/Germanic
notes: Cycles toward Ragnarök; warrior agency; immanent pantheon/land-wights.

name: Thracian/Daсian (Zalmoxian)
notes: Immortality cult; communal rites; immanent underworld/sky links.

name: Etruscan
notes: Divination (haruspicy); civic-portent logic; immanent omen-bound order.

name: Minoan (Aegean)
notes: Peak sanctuaries; fertility & maritime cycles; goddess-centric immanence.

name: Scythian/Sarmatian (Steppe)
notes: Shamanic-royal cults; sky/horse symbolism; mobile cyclical rites.
